options.fig-cap: Illustration of a poor graphic using the Organic Food Case Study; the graphic does not give us a sense of variability.  As a result, it is not clear how different these means really are.
options.fig-alt: Bar chart of the average moral expectations for individuals exposed to one of three types of food types; no sense of variability is given.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-9

options.fig-cap: Comparison of the moral expectations for college students exposed to different types of food.
options.fig-alt: Side-by-side boxplots of the moral expectations for three different food categories.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-10

options.fig-cap: Multiple ways to effectively compare a quantitative response (in this case, the moral expectation score) across multiple groups (in this case, the type of food to which the participant was exposed).
options.label: unnamed-chunk-11
